cards.name: Oddish
cards.text: During the day, it stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.

attacks.name: Feelin' Fine
attacks.text: Draw a card.

cards.name: Gloom
cards.text: What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey. It is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.

attacks.name: Inviting Scent
attacks.text: Switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot.

cards.name: Bellossom
cards.text: Bellossom gather at times and appear to dance. They say that the dance is a ritual to summon the sun.

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Powerful Dance
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 90 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Scyther
cards.text: It slashes through grass with its sharp scythes, moving too fast for the human eye to track.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Shuckle
cards.text: The berries stored in its vaselike shell eventually become a thick, pulpy juice.

attacks.name: Berry Scent
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Surskit
cards.text: They usually live on ponds, but after an evening shower, they may appear on puddles in towns.

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Masquerain
cards.text: It flaps its four wings to hover and fly freely in any direction—to and fro and sideways.

attacks.name: Panic-Prompting Pattern
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

cards.name: Combee
cards.text: At night, Combee sleep in a group of about a hundred, packed closely together in a lump.

attacks.name: Share
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Foongus
cards.text: There is a theory that the developer of the modern-day Poké Ball really liked Foongus, but this has not been confirmed.

attacks.name: Enticing Pattern
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Grass Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Amoonguss
cards.text: Be wary of the poisonous spores it releases. Mushrooms resembling Amoonguss's caps will grow out of anywhere the spores touch.

attacks.name: Dangerous Spores
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

cards.name: Phantump
cards.text: With a voice like a human child's, it cries out to lure adults deep into the forest, getting them lost among the trees.

cards.name: Trevenant

abilities.name: Forest Miasma
abilities.text: During Pokémon Checkup, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, put 1 damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.text: Small roots that extend from the tips of this Pokémon's feet can tie into the trees of the forest and give Trevenant control over them.

attacks.name: Lock Up
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

cards.name: Rowlet
cards.text: It feels relaxed in tight, dark places and has been known to use its Trainer's pocket or bag as a nest.

cards.name: Dartrix
cards.text: Supremely sensitive to the presence of others, it can detect opponents standing behind it, flinging its sharp feathers to take them out.

attacks.name: Shoot Through
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Decidueye ex

abilities.name: Total Freedom
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may use this Ability. If this Pokémon is on the Bench, switch it with your Active Pokémon. Or, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, switch it with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hunting Arrow
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Bounsweet
cards.text: Its sweat is sweet, like syrup made from boiled-down fruit. Because of this, Bounsweet was highly valued in the past, when sweeteners were scarce.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Steenee
cards.text: Steenee spreads a sweet scent that makes others feel invigorated. This same scent is popular for antiperspirants.

attacks.name: Aromatherapy
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Pokémon.

cards.name: Tsareena
cards.text: This Pokémon is proud and aggressive. However, it is said that a Tsareena will instantly become calm if someone touches the crown on its calyx.

attacks.name: Queenly Heel
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, Pokémon can't be played from your opponent's hand to evolve the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spinning Kick
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

cards.name: Smoliv
cards.text: It protects itself from enemies by emitting oil from the fruit on its head. This oil is bitter and astringent enough to make someone flinch.

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Dolliv
cards.text: Dolliv shares its tasty, fresh-scented oil with others. This species has coexisted with humans since times long gone.

attacks.name: Sunny Wind
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Arboliva
cards.text: This calm Pokémon is very compassionate. It will share its delicious, nutrient-rich oil with weakened Pokémon.

attacks.name: Healing Fruit
attacks.text: Heal all damage from 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Toedscruel ex

abilities.name: Protective Mycelium
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks used by your opponent's Pokémon done to all of your Pokémon that have Energy attached. (Existing effects are not removed. Damage is not an effect.)

cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Colony Rush
attacks.text: This attack does 40 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon that has any Grass Energy attached.

cards.name: Capsakid
cards.text: The more sunlight this Pokémon bathes in, the more spicy chemicals are produced by its body, and thus the spicier its moves become.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Capsakid
cards.text: The more sunlight this Pokémon bathes in, the more spicy chemicals are produced by its body, and thus the spicier its moves become.

attacks.name: Double Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Scovillain

abilities.name: Double Type
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in play, it is Grass and Fire type.

cards.text: The red head converts spicy chemicals into fire energy and blasts the surrounding area with a super spicy stream of flame.

attacks.name: Spicy Headbutt
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

cards.name: Charmander
cards.text: From the time it is born, a flame burns at the tip of its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to go out.

attacks.name: Heat Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Charmeleon
cards.text: If it becomes agitated during battle, it spouts intense flames, incinerating its surroundings.

attacks.name: Heat Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

cards.name: Vulpix
cards.text: As each tail grows, its fur becomes more lustrous. When held, it feels slightly warm.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Ninetales
cards.text: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1,000-year curse.

attacks.name: Nine-Tailed Dance
attacks.text: Put 9 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

cards.name: Entei

abilities.name: Pressure
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, attacks used by your opponent's Active Pokémon do 20 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: It is said that when it roars, a volcano erupts somewhere around the globe.

attacks.name: Blaze Ball
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Numel
cards.text: Magma of almost 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit courses through its body. When it grows cold, the magma hardens and slows it.

attacks.name: Hot Magma
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.name: Camerupt
cards.text: It lives in the crater of a volcano. It is well known that the humps on its back erupt every 10 years.

attacks.name: Eruption
attacks.text: Discard the top card of each player's deck. This attack does 100 more damage for each Energy card discarded in this way.

cards.name: Victini ex
cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Strafe
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Victory Flame
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

cards.name: Darumaka
cards.text: This popular symbol of good fortune will never fall over in its sleep, no matter how it's pushed or pulled.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Darmanitan
cards.text: This Pokémon's power level rises along with the temperature of its fire, which can reach 2,500 degrees Fahrenheit.

attacks.name: Damage Counterpunch
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: Litwick
cards.text: The younger the life this Pokémon absorbs, the brighter and eerier the flame on its head burns.

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

cards.name: Lampent
cards.text: It lurks in cities, pretending to be a lamp. Once it finds someone whose death is near, it will trail quietly after them.

attacks.name: Alluring Fireball
attacks.text: Switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot. This attack does 30 damage to the new Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Chandelure
cards.text: In homes illuminated by Chandelure instead of lights, funerals were a constant occurrence—or so it's said.

attacks.name: Combustion Chain
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Heatmor
cards.text: A flame serves as its tongue, melting through the hard shell of Durant so that Heatmor can devour their insides.

attacks.name: Energy Burner
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Larvesta
cards.text: This Pokémon was called the Larva That Stole the Sun. The fire Larvesta spouts from its horns can cut right through a sheet of iron.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Volcarona
cards.text: Its burning body causes it to be unpopular in hot parts of the world, but in cold ones, Volcarona is revered as an embodiment of the sun.

attacks.name: Flame Cloak
attacks.text: Attach a Basic Fire Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Eiscue ex
cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.,Tera: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Scalding Block
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon. During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't attack.

cards.name: Charcadet
cards.text: Burnt charcoal came to life and became a Pokémon. Possessing a fiery fighting spirit, Charcadet will battle even tough opponents.

cards.name: Armarouge

abilities.name: Scorching Armor
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.text: Armarouge evolved through the use of a set of armor that belonged to a distinguished warrior. This Pokémon is incredibly loyal.

cards.name: Lapras
cards.text: Crossing icy seas is no issue for this cold-resistant Pokémon. Its smooth skin is a little cool to the touch.

attacks.name: Hail
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Carvanha
cards.text: These Pokémon have sharp fangs and powerful jaws. Sailors avoid Carvanha dens at all costs.

cards.name: Sharpedo
cards.text: This Pokémon is known as the Bully of the Sea. Any ship entering the waters Sharpedo calls home will be attacked—no exceptions.

attacks.name: Aqua Impact
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

cards.name: Buizel
cards.text: It spins its two tails like a screw to propel itself through water. The tails also slice clinging seaweed.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

cards.name: Floatzel
cards.text: With its flotation sac inflated, it can carry people on its back. It deflates the sac before it dives.

attacks.name: Swirling Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put your opponent's Active Pokémon and all attached cards into your opponent's hand.

cards.name: Tympole
cards.text: It uses sound waves to communicate with others of its kind. People and other Pokémon species can't hear its cries of warning.

attacks.name: Screw Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Palpitoad
cards.text: On occasion, their cries are sublimely pleasing to the ear. Palpitoad with larger lumps on their bodies can sing with a wider range of sounds.

cards.name: Seismitoad

abilities.name: Quaking Zone
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, attacks used by your opponent's Active Pokémon cost Colorless more.

cards.text: This Pokémon is popular among the elderly, who say the vibrations of its lumps are great for massages.

attacks.name: Echoed Voice
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Echoed Voice attack does 100 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Cubchoo
cards.text: Many of this species can be found along the shorelines of cold regions. If a Cubchoo lacks dangling snot, there's a chance it is sick.

attacks.name: Trip Over
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Beartic
cards.text: It is a ferocious, carnivorous Pokémon. Once it captures its prey, it will breathe cold air onto the prey to freeze and preserve it.

attacks.name: Frost Purge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Cryogonal
cards.text: Cryogonal appear during cold seasons. It is said that people and Pokémon who die on snowy mountains are reborn into these Pokémon.

attacks.name: First Freeze
attacks.text: If you go second and it's your first turn, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Froakie
cards.text: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.

attacks.name: Try Bouncing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Frogadier
cards.text: Its swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 600 metres in a minute's time.

attacks.name: Strafe
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Wiglett
cards.text: This Pokémon can pick up the scent of a Veluza just over 65 feet away and will hide itself in the sand.

cards.name: Wugtrio
cards.text: It has a vicious temperament, contrary to what its appearance may suggest. It wraps its long bodies around prey, then drags the prey into its den.

attacks.name: Entwining Entrapment
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

cards.name: Finizen
cards.text: It likes playing with others of its kind using the water ring on its tail. It uses ultrasonic waves to sense the emotions of other living creatures.

attacks.name: Valiant Evolution
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Finizen
cards.text: It likes playing with others of its kind using the water ring on its tail. It uses ultrasonic waves to sense the emotions of other living creatures.

cards.name: Palafin
cards.text: This Pokémon's ancient genes have awakened. It is now so extraordinarily strong that it can easily lift a cruise ship with one fin.

attacks.name: Jet Punch
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Justice Kick
attacks.text: If this Pokémon didn't move from the Bench to the Active Spot this turn, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Magnemite
cards.text: The electromagnetic waves emitted by the units at the sides of its head expel antigravity, which allows it to float.

cards.name: Magneton
cards.text: Three Magnemite are linked by a strong magnetic force. Earaches will occur if you get too close.

cards.name: Magnezone
cards.text: As it zooms through the sky, this Pokémon seems to be receiving signals of unknown origin while transmitting signals of unknown purpose.

attacks.name: Magnetic Repulsion
attacks.text: You may switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Tyranitar ex
cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.,Tera: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Mountain Hurl
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your deck.

attacks.name: Lightning Rampage
attacks.text: If your Benched Pokémon have any damage counters on them, this attack does 100 more damage.

cards.name: Tynamo
cards.text: While one alone doesn't have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.

cards.name: Eelektrik
cards.text: They coil around foes and shock them with electricity-generating organs that seem simply to be circular patterns.

attacks.name: Volt Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Eelektross
cards.text: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.

attacks.name: Suction Shock
attacks.text: Switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot. If you do, this attack does 60 damage to the new Active Pokémon, and then flip a coin. If heads, that Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Thundurus

abilities.name: Adverse Weather
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, prevent all damage done to your Benched Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.text: As it flies around, it shoots lightning all over the place and causes forest fires. It is therefore disliked.

attacks.name: Gigantic Bolt
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 90 damage to itself.

cards.name: Toxel
cards.text: It has no problem drinking dirty water. An organ inside Toxel's body filters such water into a poisonous liquid that is harmless to Toxel.

attacks.name: Slight Intrusion
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Toxtricity
cards.text: Many youths admire the way this Pokémon listlessly picks fights and keeps its cool no matter what opponent it faces.

attacks.name: Leer
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Loud Mix
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each different type of Pokémon on your Bench.

cards.name: Pawmot ex
cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Levin Strike
attacks.text: Discard 2 Lightning Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 220 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Tadbulb
cards.text: Tadbulb shakes its tail to generate electricity. If it senses danger, it will make its head blink on and off to alert its allies.

attacks.name: Energize
attacks.text: Attach a Basic Lightning Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Tadbulb
cards.text: Tadbulb shakes its tail to generate electricity. If it senses danger, it will make its head blink on and off to alert its allies.

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Tadbulb
cards.text: Tadbulb shakes its tail to generate electricity. If it senses danger, it will make its head blink on and off to alert its allies.

attacks.name: Shake and Discharge
attacks.text: This attack also does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Bellibolt
cards.text: When this Pokémon expands and contracts its wobbly body, the belly-button dynamo in its stomach produces a huge amount of electricity.

attacks.name: Electrobullet
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Bellibolt

abilities.name: Insulator
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Lightning Pokémon.

cards.text: When this Pokémon expands and contracts its wobbly body, the belly-button dynamo in its stomach produces a huge amount of electricity.

attacks.name: Thunderous Edge
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Miraidon ex
cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rapid Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Techno Turbo
attacks.text: Attach a Basic Lightning Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Cleffa
cards.text: Because of its unusual, starlike silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.

attacks.name: Grasping Draw
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have 7 cards in your hand.

cards.name: Clefairy
cards.text: Its adorable behavior and cry make it highly popular. However, this cute Pokémon is rarely found.

attacks.name: Slap Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Clefable ex

abilities.name: Lunar Zone
abilities.text: All of your Pokémon that have Psychic Energy attached have no Retreat Cost.

cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Wondrous Moon
attacks.text: You may move any amount of Psychic Energy from your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

cards.name: Togepi
cards.text: It is considered to be a symbol of good luck. Its shell is said to be filled with happiness.

attacks.name: Whiny Voice
attacks.text: Choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into their deck.

cards.name: Togetic
cards.text: It grows dispirited if it is not with kind people. It can float in midair without moving its wings.

attacks.name: Shared Peace
attacks.text: Each player draws 3 cards.

cards.name: Togekiss

abilities.name: Precious Gift
abilities.text: Once at the end of your turn (after your attack), you may use this Ability. Draw cards until you have 8 cards in your hand.

cards.text: Known as a bringer of blessings, it's been depicted on good-luck charms since ancient times.

attacks.name: Power Cyclone
attacks.text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Espeon
cards.text: The tip of its forked tail quivers when it is predicting its opponent's next move.

attacks.name: Psychic Assault
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Snubbull
cards.text: In contrast to its appearance, it's quite timid. When playing with other puppy Pokémon, it sometimes gets bullied.

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Granbull
cards.text: Although it's popular with young people, Granbull is timid and sensitive, so it's totally incompetent as a watchdog.

attacks.name: Wild Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Mawile
cards.text: It chomps with its gaping mouth. Its huge jaws are actually steel horns that have been transformed.

attacks.name: Mischievous Crunch
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each Psychic Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Spoink
cards.text: Spoink will die if it stops bouncing. The pearl on its head amplifies its psychic powers.

cards.name: Grumpig
cards.text: It can perform odd dance steps to influence foes. Its style of dancing became hugely popular overseas.

attacks.name: Powerful Steps
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Lunatone

abilities.name: New Moon
abilities.text: If you have Solrock in play, prevent all effects of any Stadium done to your Pokémon in play.

cards.text: It was discovered at the site of a meteor strike 40 years ago. Its stare can lull its foes to sleep.

cards.name: Solrock
cards.text: Solar energy is the source of its power, so it is strong during the daytime. When it spins, its body shines.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Baltoy
cards.text: It was discovered in ancient ruins. While moving, it constantly spins. It stands on one foot even when asleep.

attacks.name: Rapid Spin
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

cards.name: Claydol
cards.text: It appears to have been born from clay dolls made by ancient people. It uses telekinesis to float and move.

attacks.name: Kaboom Doll
attacks.text: Put damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon until its remaining HP is 10. If you placed any damage counters in this way, this attack also does 120 damage to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mind Bend
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Vespiquen ex
cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.,Tera: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Healing Pheromone
attacks.text: Heal 60 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Phantom Queen
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.

cards.name: Sinistea
cards.text: The soul of someone who died alone possessed some leftover tea. This Pokémon appears in hotels and houses.

attacks.name: Cold Tea
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Polteageist
cards.text: The tea that composes Polteageist's body has a distinct and enjoyable flavor. Drinking too much, however, can be fatal.

attacks.name: Antique Collecting
attacks.text: Put up to 2 in any combination of Item cards and Pokémon Tool cards from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Pour Tea
attacks.text: Put 5 damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Greavard
cards.text: It is said that a dog Pokémon that died in the wild without ever interacting with a human was reborn as this Pokémon.

cards.name: Greavard
cards.text: It is said that a dog Pokémon that died in the wild without ever interacting with a human was reborn as this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Play Rough
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Houndstone
cards.text: Houndstone spends most of its time sleeping in graveyards. Among all the dog Pokémon, this one is most loyal to its master.

attacks.name: Two Four-ocious
attacks.text: If your opponent has exactly 2 or 4 Prize cards remaining, this attack does 120 more damage.

cards.name: Houndstone ex
cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Big Bite
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Last Respects
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each Psychic Pokémon in your discard pile.

cards.name: Diglett
cards.text: It lives about one yard underground, where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears aboveground.

attacks.name: Hole-Diggin' Noggin
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your deck.

cards.name: Dugtrio
cards.text: Its three heads bob separately up and down to loosen the soil nearby, making it easier for it to burrow.

attacks.name: Dig
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Larvitar
cards.text: Born deep underground, this Pokémon becomes a pupa after eating enough dirt to make a mountain.

cards.name: Pupitar
cards.text: This pupa flies around wildly by venting with great force the gas pressurized inside its body.

attacks.name: Blasting Tackle
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Nosepass
cards.text: It hunts without twitching a muscle by pulling in its prey with powerful magnetism. But sometimes it pulls natural enemies in close.

attacks.name: Iron Collecting
attacks.text: Put up to 2 Basic Metal Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.

cards.name: Barboach
cards.text: Its two whiskers provide a sensitive radar. Even in muddy waters, it can detect its prey's location.

attacks.name: Hide
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Whiscash
cards.text: It is extremely protective of its territory. If any foe approaches, it attacks using vicious tremors.

attacks.name: Raging and Rocking
attacks.text: For each Fighting Energy attached to this Pokémon, discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

cards.name: Bonsly
cards.text: In order to adjust the level of fluids in its body, it exudes water from its eyes. This makes it appear to be crying.

attacks.name: Blubbering
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Drilbur
cards.text: It's a digger, using its claws to burrow through the ground. It causes damage to vegetable crops, so many farmers have little love for it.

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

cards.name: Stunfisk

abilities.name: Custom Trap
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, has a Pokémon Tool attached, and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 5 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

cards.text: For some reason, this Pokémon smiles slightly when it emits a strong electric current from the yellow markings on its body.

attacks.name: Rumble
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

cards.name: Diggersby
cards.text: The fur on its belly retains heat exceptionally well. People used to make heavy winter clothing from fur shed by this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Knocking Hammer
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

cards.name: Crabrawler
cards.text: This Pokémon punches trees and eats the berries that drop down, training itself and getting food at the same time.

cards.name: Crabominable
cards.text: The detached pincers of these Pokémon are delicious. Some Trainers bring Lechonk into the mountains just to search for them.

attacks.name: Knuckle Impact
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

cards.name: Rockruff
cards.text: This Pokémon is very friendly when it's young. Its disposition becomes vicious once it matures, but it never forgets the kindness of its master.

cards.name: Lycanroc
cards.text: This Pokémon uses its rocky mane to slash any who approach. It will even disobey its Trainer if it dislikes the orders it was given.

attacks.name: Finishing Fang
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has no damage counters on it before this attack does damage, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Toedscool
cards.text: Toedscool lives in muggy forests. The flaps that fall from its body are chewy and very delicious.

cards.name: Toedscruel
cards.text: These Pokémon gather into groups and form colonies deep within forests. They absolutely hate it when strangers approach.

attacks.name: Double Whip
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 100 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Klawf ex

abilities.name: Counterattacking Pincer
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), discard an Energy from the Attacking Pokémon.

cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Falling Press
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Glimmet
cards.text: It absorbs nutrients from cave walls. The petals it wears are made of crystallized poison.

attacks.name: Iron Defense
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks.

cards.name: Glimmet
cards.text: It absorbs nutrients from cave walls. The petals it wears are made of crystallized poison.

attacks.name: Poison Shard
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Glimmora ex

abilities.name: Dust Field
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, your opponent can't have more than 3 Benched Pokémon. If they have 4 or more Benched Pokémon, they discard Benched Pokémon until they have 3 Pokémon on the Bench. If more than one effect changes the number of Benched Pokémon allowed, use the smaller number.

cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Poisonous Gem
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Koraidon ex
cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Splitting Beam
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Gaia Press
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Charizard ex

abilities.name: Infernal Reign
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 3 Basic Fire Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.,Tera: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Burning Darkness
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

cards.name: Paldean Wooper
cards.text: After losing a territorial struggle, Wooper began living on land. The Pokémon changed over time, developing a poisonous film to protect its body.

attacks.name: Spit Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Paldean Wooper
cards.text: After losing a territorial struggle, Wooper began living on land. The Pokémon changed over time, developing a poisonous film to protect its body.

cards.name: Paldean Clodsire
cards.text: When attacked, this Pokémon will retaliate by sticking thick spines out from its body. It's a risky move that puts everything on the line.

attacks.name: Poison Ring
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. During your opponent's next turn, that Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Muddy Hammer
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

cards.name: Paldean Clodsire
cards.text: When attacked, this Pokémon will retaliate by sticking thick spines out from its body. It's a risky move that puts everything on the line.

attacks.name: Splattering Poison
attacks.text: Both Active Pokémon are now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 120 more damage.

cards.name: Umbreon
cards.text: When exposed to the moon's aura, the rings on its body glow faintly and it gains a mysterious power.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance, or by any effects on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Pitch-Black Blade
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

cards.name: Houndour
cards.text: It is smart enough to hunt in packs. It uses a variety of cries for communicating with others.

attacks.name: Coordinated Pack
attacks.text: For each of your Benched Houndour, search your deck for a Basic Darkness Energy card and attach it to that Houndour. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Focus Fangs
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Houndour
cards.text: It is smart enough to hunt in packs. It uses a variety of cries for communicating with others.

cards.name: Houndoom
cards.text: If you are burned by the flames it shoots from its mouth, the pain will never go away.

attacks.name: Daring Strike
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, this attack does 70 more damage.

attacks.name: Shadow Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Houndoom ex
cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Evil Claw
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Hound's Fang
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Absol ex
cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Future Sight
attacks.text: Look at the top 3 cards of either player's deck and put them back in any order.

attacks.name: Cursed Slug
attacks.text: If your opponent has 3 or fewer cards in their hand, this attack does 120 more damage.

cards.name: Darkrai
cards.text: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.

attacks.name: Dark Slumber
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Night Cyclone
attacks.text: Move all Energy from this Pokémon to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

cards.name: Inkay
cards.text: By exposing foes to the blinking of its luminescent spots, Inkay demoralizes them, and then it seizes the chance to flee.

attacks.name: Hug
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

cards.name: Malamar

abilities.name: Psychic Insight
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may look at the top card of your opponent's deck. If you do, look at the top card of your deck.

cards.text: It's said that Malamar's hypnotic powers played a role in certain history-changing events.

attacks.name: Hypnotic Ray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Salandit
cards.text: It taunts its prey and lures them into narrow, rocky areas where it then sprays them with toxic gas to make them dizzy and take them down.

cards.name: Salazzle
cards.text: Salazzle makes its opponents light-headed with poisonous gas, then captivates them with alluring movements to turn them into loyal servants.

cards.name: Scizor
cards.text: This Pokémon's pincers, which contain steel, can crush any hard object they get ahold of into bits.

attacks.name: Punishing Scissors
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each of your opponent's Pokémon in play that has an Ability.

cards.name: Skarmory
cards.text: People fashion swords from Skarmory's shed feathers, so this Pokémon is a popular element in heraldic designs.

attacks.name: Slashing Steel
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Slashing Steel.

cards.name: Mawile

abilities.name: Special Eater
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.text: It chomps with its gaping mouth. Its huge jaws are actually steel horns that have been transformed.

cards.name: Bronzor
cards.text: Ancient people believed that the pattern on Bronzor's back contained a mysterious power.

attacks.name: Mirror Draw
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent.

cards.name: Bronzong
cards.text: In ages past, this Pokémon was revered as a bringer of rain. It was found buried in the ground.

attacks.name: Oracle Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks used by your opponent's Pokémon done to this Pokémon. (Damage is not an effect.)

attacks.name: Extrasensory
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 90 more damage.

cards.name: Probopass
cards.text: It uses three small units to catch prey and battle enemies. The main body mostly just gives orders.

attacks.name: Triple Nose
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Iron Buster
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

cards.name: Excadrill
cards.text: Known as the Drill King, this Pokémon can tunnel through the terrain at speeds of over 90 mph.

cards.name: Pawniard
cards.text: Pawniard will fearlessly challenge even powerful foes. In a pinch, it will cling to opponents and pierce them with the blades all over its body.

attacks.name: Triple Cutter
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Bisharp
cards.text: This Pokémon commands a group of several Pawniard. Groups that are defeated in territorial disputes are absorbed by the winning side.

attacks.name: Fury Cutter
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If 1 of them is heads, this attack does 20 more damage. If 2 of them are heads, this attack does 60 more damage. If all of them are heads, this attack does 120 more damage.

cards.name: Kingambit
cards.text: Only a Bisharp that stands above all others in its vast army can evolve into Kingambit.

attacks.name: Strike Down
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has 4 or more damage counters on it, that Pokémon is Knocked Out.

cards.name: Togedemaru
cards.text: When it's in trouble, it curls up into a ball, makes its fur spikes stand on end, and then discharges electricity indiscriminately.

attacks.name: Defense Curl
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks.

cards.name: Meltan
cards.text: They live as a group, but when the time comes, one strong Meltan will absorb all the others and evolve.

cards.name: Melmetal ex
cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Metal-bolize
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Metal Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Full Metal Knuckle
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Metal Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Varoom
cards.text: It is said that this Pokémon was born when an unknown poison Pokémon entered and inspirited an engine left at a scrap-processing factory.

attacks.name: Spinning Draw
attacks.text: Draw a card.

cards.name: Varoom
cards.text: It is said that this Pokémon was born when an unknown poison Pokémon entered and inspirited an engine left at a scrap-processing factory.

cards.name: Revavroom ex

abilities.name: Tune-Up
abilities.text: This Pokémon may have up to 4 Pokémon Tools attached to it. If it loses this Ability, discard Pokémon Tools from it until only 1 remains.

cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Wild Drift
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Dratini
cards.text: It sheds many layers of skin as it grows larger. During this process, it is protected by a rapid waterfall.

cards.name: Dragonair
cards.text: They say that if it emits an aura from its whole body, the weather will begin to change instantly.

attacks.name: Dragon Tail
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 70 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Dragonite ex
cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.,Tera: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Mighty Meteor
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 140 more damage. If tails, during your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

cards.name: Altaria
cards.text: If it bonds with a person, it will gently envelop the friend with its soft wings, then hum.

attacks.name: Soothing Lullaby
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep. During Pokémon Checkup, your opponent flips 2 coins instead of 1. If either of them is tails, that Pokémon is still Asleep.

cards.name: Drampa
cards.text: Drampa is a kind and friendly Pokémon—up until it's angered. When that happens, it stirs up a gale and flattens everything around.

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

cards.name: Pidgey
cards.text: It is docile and prefers to avoid conflict. If disturbed, however, it can ferociously strike back.

cards.name: Pidgeotto
cards.text: Very protective of its sprawling territorial area, this Pokémon will fiercely peck at any intruder.

cards.name: Pidgeot ex

abilities.name: Quick Search
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. You can't use more than 1 Quick Search Ability each turn.

cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Blustery Wind
attacks.text: You may discard a Stadium in play.

cards.name: Kangaskhan
cards.text: There are records of a lost human child being raised by a childless Kangaskhan.

attacks.name: Spike Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

cards.name: Eevee
cards.text: Its ability to evolve into many forms allows it to adapt smoothly and perfectly to any environment.

attacks.name: Cheer Up
attacks.text: Attach an Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

cards.name: Zigzagoon
cards.text: A Pokémon with abundant curiosity. It shows an interest in everything, so it always zigzags.

cards.name: Linoone
cards.text: It uses its explosive speed and razor-sharp claws to bring down prey. Running along winding paths is not its strong suit.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Swablu
cards.text: It constantly grooms its cotton-like wings. It takes a shower to clean itself if it becomes dirty.

attacks.name: Fluffy Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Lillipup
cards.text: This Pokémon is far brighter than the average child, and Lillipup won't forget the love it receives or any abuse it suffers.

cards.name: Herdier
cards.text: The black fur that covers this Pokémon's body is dense and springy. Even sharp fangs bounce right off.

cards.name: Stoutland
cards.text: Stoutland is immensely proud of its impressive moustache. It's said that moustache length is what determines social standing among this species.

attacks.name: Chomp Chomp Panic
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

cards.name: Audino
cards.text: This Pokémon has a kind heart. By touching with its feelers, Audino can gauge other creatures' feelings and physical conditions.

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Bouffalant

abilities.name: Bouffer
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: These Pokémon live in herds of about 20 individuals. Bouffalant that betray the herd will lose the hair on their heads for some reason.

attacks.name: Damage Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Bunnelby
cards.text: It's very sensitive to danger. The sound of Corviknight's flapping will have Bunnelby digging a hole to hide underground in moments.

attacks.name: Stompy Stomp
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Yungoos
cards.text: Its stomach fills most of its torso. It wanders the same path every day, searching for fresh food.

attacks.name: Knock Away
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

cards.name: Gumshoos
cards.text: Once it finds signs of prey, it will patiently stake out the location, waiting until the sun goes down.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Skwovet
cards.text: It stores berries in its cheeks. When there are no berries to be found, Skwovet will stuff pebbles into its cheeks to stave off its cravings.

attacks.name: Nicked Nibble
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

cards.name: Greedent ex
cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.,Tera: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Never Ever Enough
attacks.text: Look at the top 3 cards of your deck. You may put those cards into your hand. If you don't, discard those cards and draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Slip 'n' Roll
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Slip 'n' Roll.

cards.name: Lechonk
cards.text: It searches for food all day. It possesses a keen sense of smell but doesn't use it for anything other than foraging.

cards.name: Lechonk
cards.text: It searches for food all day. It possesses a keen sense of smell but doesn't use it for anything other than foraging.

attacks.name: Disarming Voice
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Lechonk
cards.text: It searches for food all day. It possesses a keen sense of smell but doesn't use it for anything other than foraging.

cards.name: Oinkologne
cards.text: Oinkologne is proud of its fine, glossy skin. It emits a concentrated scent from the tip of its tail.

attacks.name: Confounding Cologne
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: High-Impact Kick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon also does 60 damage to itself.

cards.name: Oinkologne
cards.text: This Pokémon sends a flowerlike scent wafting about. Well-developed muscles in its legs allow it to leap more than 16 feet with no trouble at all.

attacks.name: Finest Selection
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. Put a number of cards up to the number of heads from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Perfume Press
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Flamigo
cards.text: This Pokémon apparently ties the base of its neck into a knot so that the energy stored in its belly does not escape from its beak.

attacks.name: Synchronized Feathers
attacks.text: If Flamigo is on your Bench, this attack also does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Arven
cards.text: Search your deck for an Item card and a Pokémon Tool card, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Brassius
cards.text: Count the cards in your hand, shuffle those cards into your deck, then draw that many cards plus 1.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Geeta
cards.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck. During this turn, your Pokémon can't attack. (This includes Pokémon that come into play this turn.),You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Letter of Encouragement
cards.text: You can use this card only if any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn.,Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Ortega
cards.text: Your opponent reveals their hand, and you choose a card you find there and put it on the bottom of their deck. If you put a card on the bottom of your opponent's deck in this way, your opponent may draw a card.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Patrol Cap
cards.text: As long as the Pokémon this card is attached to is in the Active Spot, cards in your deck can't be discarded by effects of your opponent's attacks, Abilities, Item cards, Pokémon Tool cards, or Supporter cards.,You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.

cards.name: Pokémon League Headquarters
cards.text: Attacks used by each Basic Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) cost Colorless more.,You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

cards.name: Poppy
cards.text: Move up to 2 Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Ryme
cards.text: Draw 3 cards. Switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.),You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Team Star Grunt
cards.text: Put an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon on top of their deck.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Town Store
cards.text: Once during each player's turn, that player may search their deck for a Pokémon Tool card, reveal it, and put it into their hand. Then, that player shuffles their deck.,You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

cards.name: Vengeful Punch
cards.text: If the Pokémon this card is attached to is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, put 4 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.,You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.

cards.name: Gloom
cards.text: What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey. It is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.

attacks.name: Inviting Scent
attacks.text: Switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot.

cards.name: Ninetales
cards.text: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1,000-year curse.

attacks.name: Nine-Tailed Dance
attacks.text: Put 9 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

cards.name: Palafin
cards.text: This Pokémon's ancient genes have awakened. It is now so extraordinarily strong that it can easily lift a cruise ship with one fin.

attacks.name: Jet Punch
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Justice Kick
attacks.text: If this Pokémon didn't move from the Bench to the Active Spot this turn, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Bellibolt

abilities.name: Insulator
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Lightning Pokémon.

cards.text: When this Pokémon expands and contracts its wobbly body, the belly-button dynamo in its stomach produces a huge amount of electricity.

attacks.name: Thunderous Edge
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Cleffa
cards.text: Because of its unusual, starlike silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.

attacks.name: Grasping Draw
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have 7 cards in your hand.

cards.name: Larvitar
cards.text: Born deep underground, this Pokémon becomes a pupa after eating enough dirt to make a mountain.

cards.name: Houndour
cards.text: It is smart enough to hunt in packs. It uses a variety of cries for communicating with others.

attacks.name: Coordinated Pack
attacks.text: For each of your Benched Houndour, search your deck for a Basic Darkness Energy card and attach it to that Houndour. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Focus Fangs
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Scizor
cards.text: This Pokémon's pincers, which contain steel, can crush any hard object they get ahold of into bits.

attacks.name: Punishing Scissors
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each of your opponent's Pokémon in play that has an Ability.

cards.name: Varoom
cards.text: It is said that this Pokémon was born when an unknown poison Pokémon entered and inspirited an engine left at a scrap-processing factory.

attacks.name: Spinning Draw
attacks.text: Draw a card.

cards.name: Pidgey
cards.text: It is docile and prefers to avoid conflict. If disturbed, however, it can ferociously strike back.

cards.name: Pidgeotto
cards.text: Very protective of its sprawling territorial area, this Pokémon will fiercely peck at any intruder.

cards.name: Lechonk
cards.text: It searches for food all day. It possesses a keen sense of smell but doesn't use it for anything other than foraging.

cards.name: Eiscue ex
cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.,Tera: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Scalding Block
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon. During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't attack.

cards.name: Tyranitar ex
cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.,Tera: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Mountain Hurl
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your deck.

attacks.name: Lightning Rampage
attacks.text: If your Benched Pokémon have any damage counters on them, this attack does 100 more damage.

cards.name: Vespiquen ex
cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.,Tera: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Healing Pheromone
attacks.text: Heal 60 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Phantom Queen
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.

cards.name: Glimmora ex

abilities.name: Dust Field
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, your opponent can't have more than 3 Benched Pokémon. If they have 4 or more Benched Pokémon, they discard Benched Pokémon until they have 3 Pokémon on the Bench. If more than one effect changes the number of Benched Pokémon allowed, use the smaller number.

cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Poisonous Gem
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Absol ex
cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Future Sight
attacks.text: Look at the top 3 cards of either player's deck and put them back in any order.

attacks.name: Cursed Slug
attacks.text: If your opponent has 3 or fewer cards in their hand, this attack does 120 more damage.

cards.name: Charizard ex

abilities.name: Infernal Reign
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 3 Basic Fire Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.,Tera: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Burning Darkness
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

cards.name: Revavroom ex

abilities.name: Tune-Up
abilities.text: This Pokémon may have up to 4 Pokémon Tools attached to it. If it loses this Ability, discard Pokémon Tools from it until only 1 remains.

cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Wild Drift
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Pidgeot ex

abilities.name: Quick Search
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. You can't use more than 1 Quick Search Ability each turn.

cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Blustery Wind
attacks.text: You may discard a Stadium in play.

cards.name: Geeta
cards.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck. During this turn, your Pokémon can't attack. (This includes Pokémon that come into play this turn.),You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Ortega
cards.text: Your opponent reveals their hand, and you choose a card you find there and put it on the bottom of their deck. If you put a card on the bottom of your opponent's deck in this way, your opponent may draw a card.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Poppy
cards.text: Move up to 2 Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Ryme
cards.text: Draw 3 cards. Switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.),You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Eiscue ex
cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.,Tera: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

cards.name: Artazon
cards.text: Once during each player's turn, that player may search their deck for a Basic Pokémon that doesn't have a Rule Box and put it onto their Bench. Then, that player shuffles their deck. (Pokémon ex, Pokémon V, etc. have Rule Boxes.),You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.
